unnormalised: As per Section 135 of the Companies Act, 2013, CSR is mandatory for companies meeting certain criteria. Advocate Sharma's analysis in the Economic Times on 20/07/2024 clarifies the implications of non-compliance for entities like TCS and Infosys. Further, amendments introduced via notification no. GSR 777(E) dated 22/05/2021, mandate impact assessment for projects with outlays exceeding Rs. 1 crore, ensuring transparency and accountability.
normalised: As per Section one hundred and thirty five of the Companies Act, two thousand and thirteen, C-S-R is mandatory for companies meeting certain criteria. Advocate Sharma's analysis in the Economic Times on twentieth July two thousand and twenty four clarifies the implications of non-compliance for entities like T-C-S and Infosys. Further, amendments introduced via notification number G-S-R seven hundred and seventy seven (E) dated twenty second May two thousand and twenty one, mandate impact assessment for projects with outlays exceeding rupee one crore, ensuring transparency and accountability.
